definitions: in a manner suggestive of or relating to a conspiracy made by a group of people to do something unlawful or harmful

examples.text: affairs were conducted conspiratorially and surreptitiously
he talks darkly and conspiratorially about the corrupt financial system

definitions: in a manner that suggests shared secret knowledge with another person

examples.text: she nudged Jonathan and winked conspiratorially

shortDefinitions: in manner that suggests shared secret knowledge with another person
